title.narrative: The Medical Laboratory Practices and Management Scholarship Course

description.narrative: Accepts laboratory staff with diploma level training or above with at least two years practical experience people from all over Africa. Some are self-funded, some employer funded, and some are funded (or partially funded) through charities like Amref.

By the end of the course, graduates should be able to: 1. Discuss principles of quality management systems 2. Demonstrate knowledge and skills in effective laboratory documentation and personnel management 3. Employ knowledge and skills in the management of laboratory resources 4. Demonstrate quality measures employed in the diagnostic cycle 5. Organize the laboratory to enhance safety and productivity 6. Develop systems for continuous quality improvement 7. Demonstrate competency in the evaluation of quality management system and customer satisfaction 8. Employ laboratory data in problem solving and decision making

The Medical Laboratory Practices and Management (MLP&M) course aims to contribute to improved health through competency-based training of medical laboratory supervisors through distance and two-week residential training over 5 months. The funding covers four students through partial bursaries.

The course is organised to run in Three Phases. Phase One and Phase Three of the training are conducted through distance learning at the participants’ work stations, and Phase Two (residential training) is conducted at the Amref Health Africa’s Central Laboratory facilities in Nairobi: - Phase One: a two-month pre-training period on assessment of the laboratory services in their own institutions; June 3 to July 26, 2019 - Phase two: a two-week residential training period to equip the participants with appropriate knowledge, skills and attitudes to undertake and apply quality management systems in their laboratory procedures, and to address diagnostic errors in their places of work for improved health care services; August 12 - 23, 2019 - Phase Three: a three-month work-based training conducted at the place of work to enable participants to theory into practice’ implement Action Plans and submit a report; September 2, to November 22, 2019
